alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 13 at 12:52PM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CZU LIGHTNING COMPLEX BURN AREA IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the CZU Lightning Complex burn area. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Northern Monterey Bay, San Francisco Peninsula Coast and Santa Cruz Mountains. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the CZU Lightning Complex burn area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the CZU Lightning Complex burn area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the CZU Lightning Complex burn area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Northern Monterey Bay, San Francisco Peninsula Coast and Santa Cruz Mountains. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the CZU burn area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains
